channel.title: CVE Feed for pyload -- pyload
channel.description: The latest CVEs for pyload -- pyload

item.title: CVE-2024-32880|2024-08-02T02:20:35.649Z -- pyload -- pyload
item.description: pyload is an open-source Download Manager written in pure Python. An authenticated user can change the download folder and upload a crafted template to the specified folder lead to remote code execution. There is no fix available at the time of publication.

item.title: CVE-2024-32880|2024-06-04T17:51:11.607Z -- pyload -- pyload
item.description: pyload is an open-source Download Manager written in pure Python. An authenticated user can change the download folder and upload a crafted template to the specified folder lead to remote code execution. There is no fix available at the time of publication.

item.title: CVE-2024-24808|2024-02-06T03:17:16.532Z -- pyload -- pyload
item.description: pyLoad is an open-source Download Manager written in pure Python. There is an open redirect vulnerability due to incorrect validation of input values when redirecting users after login. pyLoad is validating URLs via the `get_redirect_url` function when redirecting users at login. This vulnerability has been patched with commit fe94451.
